page.title: 07ECOLOGY STRACATHRO
page.content:
If you took a walk round Stracathro you would see golden barley fields, yellow oil-seed rape fields and green grassy parks with contented fat cattle chewing the cud. You would see bulls too, Charolais, Simmental and Limousin and shaggy Highland cattle. Colins dad has spotted, brown Jacob sheep, with their strange, sharp horns.
If you were lucky you might see squirrels gathering nuts or sleek roe-deer passing in the woods. If you were very lucky, you might see mink or even otters and kingfishers by the waters edge.
There are lots of heron about, especially at Mr Jemmets house near the village. John King wrote this.
